title: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow reportedly prioritizing finding a GM this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow aims to hire a general manager this offseason, according to WEEI's Rob Bradford.
The GM role has been vacant since Breslow took charge of baseball operations before the 2024 season.
Red Sox assistant GMs Raquel Ferreira, Eddie Romero, and others may be candidates for the GM position.

title: Patriots move on from Ja’Lynn Polk, reportedly trading him to Saints
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots trade wide receiver Ja'Lynn Polk to Saints for a 2027 sixth-round pick, giving up a 2028 seventh-round pick.
Polk, a 2024 second-round draft pick, struggled with 12 receptions and 87 yards in his rookie season.
Polk was placed on injured reserve for the 2025 season after a preseason shoulder injury.

title: 5 things to know about Dolphins before Patriots take them on in Week 2
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots hope to end their five-game losing streak to the Dolphins in Miami during their Week 2 matchup.
Dolphins' head coach Mike McDaniel faces scrutiny after a 33-8 loss to the Colts, leading to a players-only meeting.
Tua Tagovailoa remains undefeated against the Patriots, having won all seven of his starts against them.

title: Review & setlist: Ethel Cain haunts Roadrunner with Southern Gothic epic
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Ethel Cain performed at Roadrunner in Boston on Sept. 12, 2025, showcasing her Southern Gothic style.
Cain's setlist included tracks from albums like "Preacher's Daughter" and "Willoughby Tucker, I’ll Always Love You".
Jae Matthews of Boy Harsher joined Cain for a duet, adding a special moment to the immersive performance.

title: 45 years later, Andover High’s Chiklis returns to gridiron for ‘The Senior’
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Michael Chiklis stars as Mike Flynt in 'The Senior,' based on Flynt's real-life return to college football.
Chiklis, a Lowell native and Boston University alum, will attend a pre-release screening in Boston on September 14.
The film, directed by Rod Lurie, co-stars Rob Corddry and Mary Stuart Masterson, and releases nationally on September 19.

title: Here are the Mass. residents who made the new Forbes list of 400 richest Americans
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Nine Massachusetts residents made Forbes' list of the 400 richest Americans, ranking from 27 to 382.
Abigail Johnson is Massachusetts' richest, ranking 27th with a net worth of $35 billion, up from $31 billion.
Elon Musk leads the Forbes list with a net worth of $428 billion, followed by Mark Zuckerberg and Jeff Bezos.

title: In most anticipated series at Fenway in years, Red Sox faceplant against Yankees in opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox lost 4-1 to Yankees at Fenway Park, managing only two hits in a lackluster performance.
Boston's starter Lucas Giolito gave up two runs over 5.2 innings, while Red Sox committed three errors.
Red Sox's offensive struggles continue without key players Anthony and Abreu, going 0-for-8 with runners in scoring position.

title: Former Patriots DE Deatrich Wise Jr. suffers season-ending injury
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Former Patriots DE Deatrich Wise Jr. suffers season-ending left quad injury playing for Washington Commanders against Packers.
Wise sustained the injury during a blocked extra point attempt and will require surgery, as per ESPN's Adam Schefter.
Wise joined Washington with a one-year, $3.25 million contract after eight seasons with the Patriots.

title: When will Connelly Early pitch next for Red Sox? Alex Cora explains
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Connelly Early may start for the Red Sox on Tuesday against the Athletics at Fenway Park.
Early impressed in his MLB debut, striking out 11 A's batters over five scoreless innings.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora is considering Early, Payton Tolle, and Kyle Harrison for starting roles.

title: Scott Boras says he, Alex Bregman are ‘waiting until the offseason’ before making opt-out decision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Bregman plans to decide on his Red Sox contract opt-out during the offseason, according to agent Scott Boras.
Bregman's contract with Boston includes a three-year, $120 million deal with opt-out options after 2025 and 2026.
Bregman has become a key leader on the team, positively impacting Boston's young players this season.
